channel.title: Developing on Keydra Documentation
channel.description: Recent content in Developing on Keydra Documentation

item.title: Clients
item.description: Clients commonly live in keydra.clients, but you may be sourcing it directly from somewhere else, or have other aspirations… no judgement here. Anyway… Clients are nothing but SDKs to facilitate (keep the code clean, really) the development of Providers. See the provider documentation for more details on what’s supported.

item.title: Contribution Guidelines
item.description: Plain and simple… just cut a PR! But not so fast! Work on a feature branch Make sure you have tests Did you drop coverage, be ready to discuss why Create a Pull Request. Please ensure tests are passing before creating a PR. We also ask you to be PEP8 compliant. nosetests flake8

item.title: Providers
item.description: Providers make the magic happen. As of today they have 2 responsibilities: rotation (which depending on the provider, can also be used to provision secrets) distribution … and implement the methods described in keydra.providers.base. See the provider documentation for more details on what’s supported out of the box. Rotation During the rotate phase, the provider will be invoked with a description (dict) of a secret. So in the example below where secrets.
